result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Defendant previously posted the $5,000.00.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  The Defendant is to participate in Drug Treatment Court.  The remaining $20,000.00 is to be returned to the poster.

Defendant Gregory W Cain in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court accepts plea as, knowlingly, intelligently and voluntarily made.  Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into the DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to the DTC.  Count #2 is dismissed and read into count #1.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
